title: Basic Relational Database Specification
description: Example of database specification with no explicit schema or joins
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  // There is an implicit 'default' schema 
  Table People
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    firm_id INTEGER
  )
  Table Firms
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    legal_name VARCHAR(200)
  )
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Filter
description: Example of database specification with Filter
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  // There is an implicit 'default' schema 
  Table People
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    firm_id INTEGER
  )
  Table Firms
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    legal_name VARCHAR(200)
  )

  // Filters at the database level can be shared with several mappings
  Filter largePersonIds(People.id > 100)
)

title: Basic Relational Database Specification with Includes
description: Example of database specification with other Database definitions included
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  include store::IncludedDB

  // Definitions in included DB are available here
  Table People
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    firm_id INTEGER
  )
  Table Firms
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    legal_name VARCHAR(200)
  )
)

Database store::IncludedDB
(
  Table PeoplePart2
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    firm_id INTEGER
  )
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Milestoning
description: Example of database specification with Milestoning
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  Table People
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    firm_id INTEGER
  )
  Table Firms
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    legal_name VARCHAR(200)
  )

  Join PersonCompany(People.firm_id = Firms.id)
  // Joins can also be defined across schemas
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Join placeholder
description: Example of database specification with join placeholder.
documnetation: TODO: explain what this feature is useful for.
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  Table People
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    firm_id INTEGER
  )
  Table Firms
  (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    legal_name VARCHAR(200)
  )

  Join PersonCompany(People.id = {target}.firm_id)
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Bitemporal Milestoning
description: Example of database specification with Bitemporal Milestoning.
code:
###Relational
Database store::MilestonedDB
(
  Table BiTemporalProductTable
  (
    milestoning
    (
      processing(PROCESSING_IN = in_z, PROCESSING_OUT = out_z, INFINITY_DATE = %9999-12-31T00:00:00.0000),
      business(BUS_FROM = from_z, BUS_THRU = thru_z, INFINITY_DATE = %9999-12-31T00:00:00.0000)
    )

    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    type VARCHAR(200),
    in_z DATE,
    out_z DATE,
    from_z DATE,
    thru_z DATE
  )
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Business Milestoning
description: Example of database specification with Business Milestoning.
code:
###Relational
Database store::MilestonedDB
(
  Table ProductTable
  (
    milestoning
    (
      // A subset of the following options can be used with the minimal being BUS_FROM and BUS_THRU
      business(BUS_FROM = from_z, BUS_THRU = thru_z, THRU_IS_INCLUSIVE = true, INFINITY_DATE = %9999-12-31T00:00:00.0000)
    )

    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200) PRIMARY KEY,
    type VARCHAR(200),
    exchange VARCHAR(200),
    classificationSystemId INTEGER,
    referenceSystemName VARCHAR(200),
    externalReferenceSystemName VARCHAR(200),
    from_z DATE,
    thru_z DATE
  )
  Table ProductTableWithBusinessSnapshotMilestoning
  (
    milestoning
    (
      business(BUS_SNAPSHOT_DATE = snapshotDate)
    )

    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    type VARCHAR(200),
    snapshotDate DATE
  )
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Processing Milestoning
description: Example of database specification with Temporal Milestoning.
code:
###Relational
Database store::MilestonedDB
(
  Table BiTemporalProductTableWithProcessingMilestoning
  (
    milestoning
    (
      // The minimal set of options is PROCESSING_IN and PROCESSING_OUT
      processing(PROCESSING_IN = in_z, PROCESSING_OUT = out_z, OUT_IS_INCLUSIVE = true, INFINITY_DATE = %9999-12-31T00:00:00.0000)
    )

    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(200),
    type VARCHAR(200),
    in_z DATE,
    out_z DATE
  )
)

title: Relational Database Specification with explicit Schema
description: Example of database specification with explicit schema
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  Schema SimpleSchema
  (
    Table People
    (
      id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
      name VARCHAR(200),
      firm_id INTEGER
    )
    Table Firms
    (
      id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
      legal_name VARCHAR(200)
    )
  )
  // Joins go outside the schema
)

title: Relational Database Specification with Views
description: Example of database specification with Views.
documnetation:
Views are effectively transformations at the database level. They have the same syntax as Mappings but have a few different features.
TODO: include a description on why views are required.
code:
###Relational
Database store::SimpleDB
(
  Schema SimpleSchema
  (
    Table People
    (
      id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
      name VARCHAR(200),
      firm_id INTEGER
    )
    Table Firms
    (
      id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
      legal_name VARCHAR(200)
    )

    View ImportantPeople
    (
      id: SimpleSchema.People.id PRIMARY KEY,
      name: SimpleSchema.People.name
    )
  )
)
